Hello,

I implemented novelty search and the maze navigation task (it 
work=
s! :)), but I need to ask you about something. 

So when a new individual i=
s spawned from the population, its novelty is 
computed based on the domain=
-specific distance measure to all other 
behaviors in the population and th=
e archive, right. 

But what about the population itself, should every indi=
vidual there 
recompute its sparseness on every evaluation, based on the ne=
w 
circumstances? 

I ask this because when I observe the sparseness (I ass=
ume sparseness 
equals fitness) of the individuals, say one happens to be i=
n a very 
sparse area so it receives a high fitness score. But then a coupl=
e of 
other individuals come into this area, so it becomes more dense. But =

that first individual still has a high fitness score? Is this right? 

Pet=
er
